alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 2:12AM MST until December 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy Snow and Blowing Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches; localized higher amounts are expected along the Highway 385 corridor from Wray to Burlington. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph resulting in localized blizzard conditions. * WHERE...Yuma and Kit Carson Counties. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slick and snow packed road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility resulting in near zero visibility at times. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A heavy snow band is developing across eastern portions of Yuma and Kit Carson counties where the potential exists for significant snowfall to occur. Conditions may vary significantly across each respective county.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
